abstract: A deal would give Intel a foothold in the market for smartphone chips, a segment that is experiencing double-digit annual growth.
snippet: A deal would give Intel a foothold in the market for smartphone chips, a segment that is experiencing double-digit annual growth.
lead_paragraph: Intel was near a deal late on Sunday to acquire the wireless chip unit of Infineon Technologies, whose products are used in the Apple iPhone and other smartphones, for more than $1 billion, people involved in the negotiations said.

headline.main: Intel Is Close to Acquisition of Infineon Wireless Unit
headline.print_headline: Intel Is Close To Acquisition Of Infineon Wireless Unit

abstract: Less than two weeks after Intel said it would buy McAfee, the company announced Monday that it would acquire the German chipmaker Infineon’s wireless business for about $1.4 billion in cash.
snippet: Less than two weeks after Intel said it would buy McAfee, the company announced Monday that it would acquire the German chipmaker Infineon’s wireless business for about $1.4 billion in cash.
lead_paragraph: 3:18 a.m. | Updated Less than two weeks after Intel said it would buy McAfee, the company announced Monday that it would acquire the German chip maker Infineon‘s wireless business for about $1.4 billion in cash.

headline.main: Intel to Acquire Infineon Wireless Unit

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Chris V. Nicholson

abstract: A new application brings Bing services to Verizon Wireless phones running the Android operating system from Google.
snippet: A new application brings Bing services to Verizon Wireless phones running the Android operating system from Google.
lead_paragraph: In late 2009, when Microsoft introduced a downloadable application for the iPhone from Apple, it set off some excitement in the tech world. For years, Microsoft and Apple had been head-to-head in the war for personal computing.
